profileText: A Representative from Alabama; born near Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, N.C., December 26, 1826; attended the public schools of Marengo County, Ala., and was graduated from the University of Alabama at Tuscaloosa July 11, 1848; studied law in Mobile, Ala., but never practiced; engaged in cotton planting near Uniontown, Perry County, Ala.; member of the State house of representatives in 1880 and 1881; served in the State senate 1882-1885; elected as a Democrat to the Forty-ninth and Fiftieth Congresses (March 4, 1885-March 3, 1889); unsuccessful candidate for renomination in 1888; resumed agricultural pursuits; died at ``Westwood,'' near Uniontown, Ala., November 6, 1897; interment in the Holy Cross Cemetery of Davidson Memorial Church, Uniontown, Perry County, Ala.

note.content: Election unsuccessfully contested by John V. McDuffie.

researchRecord.name: 1826-1897. ca. 1/2 foot.
researchRecord.description: Photocopies of business and personal papers.

recordLocation.name: Alabama Department of Archives and History

researchRecord.name: In the Philip Henry Pitts papers, 1814-1884, 12 items.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Alexander Caldwell Davidson.

parentRecordLocation.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
